metadata.title: Italy Would Help Israel Mend Relations With U.S.

overview: Israel has reached out to European countries, including Italy, to assist in repairing relations with the U.S. after a rift over housing construction in East Jerusalem. Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi has offered support to Israeli PM Binyamin Netanyahu in this matter.

background.context: Israel reached out to European countries due to tensions with the U.S. regarding housing constructions in a contested area. Italian PM Berlusconi promised assistance in mending these relations.
timeline: 2023-03: Israeli PM Binyamin Netanyahu's conversation with Italian PM Silvio Berlusconi occurred.

key_findings: Israel sees a need to mend relations with the U.S. using Italy's help.
The construction of 1,600 homes in East Jerusalem is a point of contention.
Netanyahu blames the tension on a government official's mishandling.
assessments: The rift is seen as the lowest point in U.S.-Israeli relations.
Direct contact between Netanyahu and the U.S. President is lacking.
risks: Risk of Palestinians using the situation to halt peace talks.
